com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter

Class SkipDocumentFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter.AbstractDocumentFilter
      • com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter.SkipDocumentFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocumentFilterFactory

    public class SkipDocumentFilter
extends AbstractDocumentFilter
    A Document filter that forces a Document to be skipped (or not) based upon the presence/abscence of a specific Property, or based upon a match on one of the Values of that property.

    Example documentFilters.xml Configurations:

    The following example skips documents that have a NoIndex Property. 

    
   <bean id="NoIndex"
      class="com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter.SkipDocumentFilter">
     <property name="propertyName" value="NoIndex"/>
     <property name "skipOnMatch" value="true"/>
   </bean>
    The following example skips documnents whose Classification Property value is not PUBLIC or DECLASSIFIED. 
    
   <!-- Filter out all but PUBLIC and DECLASSIFIED documents. -->
   <bean id="Classified"
      class="com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter.SkipDocumentFilter">
     <property name="propertyName" value="Classification"/>
     <property name="pattern" value="(PUBLIC)|(DECLASSIFIED)"/>
     <property name "skipOnMatch" value="false"/>
   </bean>

      • SkipDocumentFilter

        public SkipDocumentFilter()

    • Method Detail

      • setPropertyName

        public void setPropertyName(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Sets the the name of the Property to match. If no pattern is set, then any Document that exposes the named property is considered a matching document. If a pattern is set, then any value of the property that matches the regular expression is considered a match.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the Property to filter
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if propertyName is null or empty

      • setPattern

        public void setPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
                throws java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException
        Sets the regular expression pattern to match in the values. The supplied pattern must conform to the syntax defined in Pattern. If one of the property's values matches this regular expression, this is considered a matching document.

        If no pattern is specified, then the mere presence of the named property would be considered a match.

        Parameters:
        pattern - the regular expression pattern to match in the values
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if pattern's syntax is invalid

      • setSkipOnMatch

        public void setSkipOnMatch(boolean skipOnMatch)
        Sets the skip document behaviour flag. If true skip the document on a match. If false skip the document on a failed match.
        Parameters:
        skipOnMatch - If true skip the document on a match, otherwise skip the document if the match fails.

      • findProperty

        public Property findProperty(Document source,
                    java.lang.String name)
                      throws RepositoryException
        Description copied from class: AbstractDocumentFilter
        Finds a Property by name. If the source Document has a property of that name, then that property is returned.

        Filter subclasses are likely to override this method.

        Overrides:
        findProperty in class AbstractDocumentFilter
        Parameters:
        source - the source Document for this filter
        name - the name of the property to find
        Returns:
        the Property, if found; null otherwise
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
